page.title: 09THE BELL AT OVERTON SCHOOL
page.content: The school was built in 1824 and the bell first rung in 1892. It was rung for 5 minutes each morning to call the children to school.Those who were late were caned. The bell was silent during the war but it was rung on V.E.Day - 8th May 1945. It has not rung since. The headteacher for the spring term 1985, Mr.G.Phillips, proposed that the bell should be restored. Mr.F.Whitehead, of Northwich, did the major work whilst Renfors U.K.Limited treated the timber. The bell will be rung at 2pm on Tuesday 2nd July by Mr. George Arthur Warburton, aged 99 years, the oldest living ex-pupil. Former pupils have been invited for a tour of the school and party after the ceremony. It is planned to ring the bell at 8.55 am and 12.55 pm each school day, 5 minutes before the start of school.
